intro: Boehmeria nakashimae, commonly known as Japanese nettle or Japanese flax, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes many stinging plants. The plant is characterized by its soft, hairy leaves and small, greenish-white flowers that appear in clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Boehmeria nakashimae is valued for its fibrous stems, which have been used traditionally in papermaking and textile production.
